title: Return to work questionnaires
text:
Background
These psychometric analyses were conducted in the SUV project, which collected longitudinal data for 165 individuals on sick-leave during one year. Analyses were made both due to an interest of investigating the psychometric properties of the questionnaires used and also in order to estimate interval level measurement values for each questionnaire.
The methodology used in based on Rasch Measurement Theory. Here is a text describing the methodology, the various subtests and their interpretation: https://pgmj.github.io/raschrvignette/RaschRvign.html

title: 1  Return to Work Self-Efficacy (RTWSE)
text:
1.1 Background
We have longitudinal data from 10 measurements.
We’ll select the datapoint with best targeting for our psychometric analysis.
Codeo_plots <- d2 %>% 
  select(!PID) %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  mutate(across(!time, ~ .x - 1)) %>% 
  split(.$time) %>% 
  map(~ RItargeting(.x %>% select(!time),xlim = c(-3,3)) + plot_annotation(title = paste0("Timepoint ",.x$time)))
Timepoint 7 looks best in terms of targeting. Sample size is 153 complete cases.
We have 7 * 4 = 28 item thresholds to estimate. 153/28 ~= 5.5 per threshold, which is low but doable when targeting is good.
Coded <- d2 %>% 
  filter(time == 7) %>% 
  select(!c(PID,time)) %>% 
  set_names(vars)

The decision tree process split the time variable in two, where the first two time points differ from the remaining 8. But looking at the magnitude of DIF, it does not seem large. We’ll run an additional comparison using partial gamma.

Codedif.time.cat <- d_time %>% 
  add_column(time = dif.time) %>% 
  mutate(time_cat = ifelse(dif.time < 2, 0, 1)) %>% 
  pull(time_cat)

partgam_DIF(as.data.frame(d_time),dif.time.cat)

title: 5  GAD-7
text:
5.4 Two separate dimensions
The initial analysis with all 7 items indicated that items 1-3 have low item fit (overfit to the Rasch model) strong residual correlations amongst them. This could mean that these items work well together, but likely represent another dimension than items 5-7, which in turn all showed high item fit (underfit).
We’ll make an analysis of this setup, including item 4 with both sets.
